meanings.definition: Officially declare someone a saint in the Roman Catholic Church.
meanings.sent1: The Pope will canonize Mother Teresa for her selfless work.
meanings.sent2: The process to canonize a saint involves thorough investigation.
meanings.sent3: Imagine if they tried to canonize a mischievous squirrel as a saint!
meanings.sent4: In the world of music, some artists are canonized for their timeless contributions.
meanings.sent5: The ceremony to canonize a saint is a solemn and revered event.

meanings.definition: Regard as being above reproach or of great significance.
meanings.sent1: Many people canonize their favorite celebrities, overlooking their flaws.
meanings.sent2: In some cultures, certain traditions are canonized as sacred rituals.
meanings.sent3: It's amusing how some individuals canonize their pets as royalty.
meanings.sent4: The ancient artifact was canonized as a symbol of wisdom and power.
meanings.sent5: The community chose to canonize the old library as a historical landmark.
